availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Ostrander (New York County, New York, attorney.)

body.p: New York County, New York, attorney. Madison County, New York, native. Married to Elmira Hall Ostrander. Father of Winifred Ostrander, Edwin Ostrander, and Edelmira Ostrander. Attended Cazenovia Seminary in Cazenovia, New York, in 1840. Attended Hamilton College in Clinton, New York. Attorney in Sauk County, Wisconsin, in 1850. Attorney in New York County, New York, in 1860. Employed Ann Lagan and Adeline Noe as domestic servants in New York County, New York, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Wisconsin, Sauk County, Prairie du Sac, p. 34B-35A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New York, New York County, District No. 2, Ward 20, p. 357.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, New York, Kings County, Brooklyn, Ward 9, p. 131A.
Reverend George Gary, First Fifty Years of the Cazenovia Seminary, 1825 to 1875: Its History - Proceedings of the Semi-Centennial Jubilee - General Catalogue (New York: Nelson & Phillips, 1877), 568.
"Alexander Ostrander Jr. (1822-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #33658477, accessed June 22, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33658477/alexander-ostrander.
